swen221.tetris.tetromino

Interface Tetromino

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTetromino, ActiveTetromino, I_Tetromino, J_Tetromino, L_Tetromino, O_Tetromino, S_Tetromino, StickyTetromino, T_Tetromino, Z_Tetromino

    public interface Tetromino
    An abstract representation of a tetromino which provides various operations for manipulating them, such as rotation and translation.
    Author:
    David J. Pearce, Marco Servetto

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Tetromino.Color
      Represents the colour of a cell on the tetris board.
      static class  Tetromino.Orientation
      The orientation of a tetromino determines the direction in which it is facing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Get the bounding box of this tetromino.
      Tetromino.Color getColor()
      Get the color of this tetromino.
      Tetromino.Orientation getOrientation()
      Get the orientation of this tetromino.
      boolean isWithin(int x, int y)
      Check whether a given coordinate on the board is within this tetromino.
      Tetromino rotate(int steps)
      Rotate this tetromino a given number of steps in a clockwise or anti-clockwise direction.

    • Method Detail

      • getColor

        Tetromino.Color getColor()
        Get the color of this tetromino.
        Returns:

      • getOrientation

        Tetromino.Orientation getOrientation()
        Get the orientation of this tetromino.
        Returns:

      • isWithin

        boolean isWithin(int x,
                 int y)
        Check whether a given coordinate on the board is within this tetromino. That is, whether or not it is one of the locations making up this tetromino. This method is used, for example, when drawing a tetrmoino. That is, we first acquire the bounding box for the tetromino and then employ this method to determine which cells are actually within the tetromino. This method can also be used to check whether a given tetromino overlaps with another, etc.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the position being checked for membership within this tetromino.
        y - The y-coordinate of the position being checked for membership within this tetromino.
        Returns:

      • getBoundingBox

        Rectangle getBoundingBox()
        Get the bounding box of this tetromino. The bounding box is the smallest rectangle which fully encloses the tetromino.
        Returns:

      • rotate

        Tetromino rotate(int steps)
        Rotate this tetromino a given number of steps in a clockwise or anti-clockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        steps - Number of steps to rotate in clockwise direction, where negative values go in the anti-clockwise direction.
